intro: Hieracium ivigtutense, commonly known as the Ivigtut hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Greenland. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in alpine and arctic regions, thriving in cold, moist environments. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
